title: "7bits/cell flash in Floadia’s AI Compute-in-Memory chip is not for SSDs"
excerpt: "Japanese microcontroller embedded flash design company Floadia has developed a 7bits/cell — yes, an actual seven bits per cell — NAND technology that can retain data for ten years at 150°C, that will be used for a AI Compute-in-Memory (CiM) operations chip."
